action.action-desc: Ms. Castor of Florida introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act with respect to device shortage notifications.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Medical Device Shortage Reduction Act of 2023.
Section 506J(a) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 356j(a)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2), by striking during, or in advance of, a public health emergency; and
in the matter following paragraph (2), by striking , during, or in advance of, a public health emergency declared by the Secretary under section 319 of the Public Health Service Act,.

subsection.text: Section 506J of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 356j) is amended by striking subsection (h) and inserting the following:

Each manufacturer of a device described in subsection (a) shall develop, maintain, and, as appropriate, implement a risk management plan that identifies and evaluates risks to the supply of the device, as applicable, for each establishment in which such device is manufactured. Such risk management plan—

paragraph.text: may identify and evaluate risks to the supply of more than 1 device, or device category, manufactured at the same establishment; and
shall be subject to inspection and copying by the Secretary pursuant to section 704 or at the request of the Secretary.

subsection.text: Section 506J(f) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 356j(f)) is amended by striking or (h) after subsection (a).

section.text: Section 506J(i) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 356j(i)) is amended by adding at the end the following: Nothing in this section shall be construed to limit the authority of the Secretary to request that a manufacturer (or other person involved in the device supply chain) provide, on a voluntary basis, information to the Secretary or the authority of the Secretary to receive such information..
